## Page pg1

Last year, the boys basketball team fell short at the state semi-finals to Lipan, ending an impressive run for the Leopards. This year the Leopards are focusing on improving last year's record, and building good relationships on the court.

“Hopefully having a good influence, impact, and a long term relationship with those players is something that will be there forever,” head coach Koby Abney said.

Assistant Coach Braeden Jones also spoke on his relationships with students, both on and off the court. When asked how coaching has changed his life for the better, Coach Jones reflects on his coaching philosophy.

“Coaching allows me to minister kids more so than I would be able to as a teacher,” Jones said. “I’m able to hopefully live my life and share my faith in a way that reflects Christ and ultimately brings more people to him.”

Abney spoke about his accomplishments while being at New Home, and how it shaped the relationships with his players. He explains his answer in the next section.

“We’ve been very blessed to have really good players, and win a lot of games and trophies. In the grand scheme of things, that stuff will fade away,” Abney stated.

Senior Zack Armes talked about how his coaches have shaped the way he plays the game. They’ve helped him grow as a person and a player.

“Coach Abney has helped keep me disciplined, humble, and make sure I do everything the right way,” Armes said.

As the team prepares to begin the season, Coach Jones knows the offseason preparation will pay off during the season.

“First game of the year will be without the guys that play football, so they’ll be a little bit short ground for numbers,” Jones said. “I think they’ve been doing a good job in the off season and all, so I think they’ll do good.”

Abney shares Coach Jones’s perspective on how the first game will go.

“Trying to figure out how the different puzzle pieces fit together this year is always a process, and I know that'll take a little bit of time,” Abney said. “I just hope that we play hard,try to do things the right way, and everything else will kind of work itself out.”
